dt: {bc}a pointed piece of wood or other material driven or to be driven into the ground as a marker or support
{bc}a post to which a person is bound for execution by burning
{bc}something that is {a_link|staked} for gain or loss
{bc}an interest or share in an undertaking or enterprise
{bc}a Mormon territorial jurisdiction comprising a group of wards
usually used in plural but singular or plural in construction

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}staca{/it}; akin to Middle Low German {it}stake{/it} pole, and perhaps to Latin {it}tignum{/it} beam
shortdef: a pointed piece of wood or other material driven or to be driven into the ground as a marker or support
a post to which a person is bound for execution by burning
execution by burning at a stake

dt: {bc}to mark the limits of by or as if by {a_link|stakes}
{bc}to fasten up or support (something, such as a plant) with stakes
{bc}to assert a title or right to something by or as if by placing stakes usually to satisfy a legal requirement

shortdef: to mark the limits of by or as if by stakes

dt: {bc}an open motortruck body consisting of a platform with upright sticks inserted along the outside edges to retain a load

shortdef: an open motortruck body consisting of a platform with upright sticks inserted along the outside edges to retain a load

dt: {bc}to assign (someone, such as a police officer) to an area usually to conduct a surveillance

shortdef: to assign (someone, such as a police officer) to an area usually to conduct a surveillance
a truck having a stake body —called also stake-bed truck

dt.t: That's the man who robbed the bank. I would {it}stake my life on{/it} it.

dt: {bc}to defend (something or someone) even though one's actions or statements may cause one trouble or harm

dt.t: She's willing to {it}go to the stake for{/it} her beliefs.

shortdef: to defend (something or someone) even though one's actions or statements may cause one trouble or harm

dt: {bc}a post that a person was tied to and burned on in the past as a form of punishment

dt.t: Joan of Arc was burned at {it}the stake{/it}.

shortdef: a post that a person was tied to and burned on in the past as a form of punishment

dt: {bc}a horse race in which the prize offered is made up at least in part of money (such as entry fees) put up by the owners of the horses entered

shortdef: a horse race in which the prize offered is made up at least in part of money (such as entry fees) put up by the owners of the horses entered —called also stake race

dt: {bc}a race or contest in which the entire prize may be awarded to the winner

et: Middle English {it}swepestake{/it} one who wins all the stakes in a game, from {it}swepen{/it} to sweep + {it}stake{/it}
shortdef: a race or contest in which the entire prize may be awarded to the winner; specifically : stakes race
